comments.body:
I'm quiet confused about this, the distribution and **application** images can't be private? They also have a param **public** param for that types.
Shouldn't **private**/**public** be a different parameter?
I am also not sure. API documentation does not state anything about it [here](https://developers.digitalocean.com/documentation/v2/#list-a-user-s-images)
I believe this relates to team accounts. Users are able to create an image for their account and not expose it to additional team members.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +122,126 @@        base_url += "type=application&"
    elif image_type == 'private':
        base_url += "private=true&"

    images = rest.get_paginated_data(base_url=base_url, data_key_name='images')
